title: The world's best cruise ships of 2017 revealed

organizations.name: royal caribbean best cruise ships for fitness & recreation ovation

text: Share 53 shares Fans of large cruise ships were most impressed by Celebrity Cruises, which was the top-rated cruise line across the most categories, winning six awards. The line's newest, and largest, ship Celebrity Reflection, won Best Cabins and Best Value as well as Best Overall vessel. Celebrity Silhouette, which features a lawn for croquet, took the title for Best Service and Best Public Rooms, while Celebrity Infinity, which sails to destinations including the Panama Canal, Africa and Colombia, received praise in the Best Shore Excursions category. In the mid-size category, Oceania's Riviera took the Best Cruise Overall crown The ship also won praise from travellers for its service. Above is the ship's pool deck Memorable cuisine: Oceania Riviera won an award for its dining offering which includes decadent desserts (left) and seared kobe beef (right) In the mid-size category, Oceania Riviera won Best Dining and Best Service alongside its Best Overall award. Thomson Cruises' Thomson Spirit also won three mid-size awards – Best Entertainment, Best Shore Excursions and Best Value. Making waves in the small ship category was Viking Ocean Cruises, which won eight awards. Holidaymakers looking for a smaller cruise ship experience were impressed with Viking Star and awarded it the Best Overall title in this category Royal Caribbean's Freedom of the Seas took the title for best cruise ship for first timers Best for Fitness in the medium ship-size category went to the P&O Oriana Viking Star was praised as Best Embarkation, Best Public Rooms, Best Service and Best Value, while Viking Sea won Best Cabins, Best Entertainment and Best Fitness, Recreation and Best Overall. For offshore excursions Voyages to Antiquity's Aegean Odyssey took the crown. Royal Caribbean’s Harmony of the Seas - which launched in 2016 and is known for its 10-storey slide, The Ultimate Abyss - wowed cruisers. Harmony of the Seas won the award for Best Cruise Ship for Families and was named top for Embarkation, both in the large vessel category The Thomson Spirit was deemed the best cruise ship in the mid-size category for entertainment In the large cruise ship category, Norwegian Epic won the entertainment title The ship was named Best for Families. Adam Coulter, UK editor Cruise Critic, said: 'Overall, the cruise industry excels in its offerings to travellers - from phenomenal entertainment to exceptional service - and these awards highlight the cruise lines that travellers rank as particularly outstanding, in order to assist those planning a cruise. 'Travellers increasingly consult consumer reviews and photos for guidance when researching, and these awards aim to streamline this process further.' Large: 2,000+ passengers; Mid-Size: 1,200 to 1,999 passengers; Small: 1,200 or fewer passengers.
